title: How to Make Rice Krispies Pops

steps.headline: On low heat, melt the butter or margarine in a large saucepan.
Pour in the marshmallows and mix until fully melted.
Shut the stove off and remove the mixture from the heat.
Fold in the cereal and mix well with a wooden spoon.
steps.description: The mixture will be sticky in the beginning, but keep mixing until properly coated.

steps.headline: Shape the Rice Krispies mixture into balls.
steps.description: Using a one-half measuring cup that's been sprayed with non-stick greasing spray, scoop the mixture into portions. Shape the mixture into medium-sized balls using greased hands for easier handling.

steps.headline: Place the pops on a baking tray and stick popsicle or lollipop sticks in the middle of each ball.
Allow the Rice Krispies pops to cool for about 10 minutes.
Separate your desired toppings into mediums-sized bowls.
Dip the pops into the melted chocolate and roll them into the desired toppings.
steps.description: Gently swirl the dipped chocolate around to remove any excess chocolate.

steps.headline: Place the pops on a baking tray covered with parchment paper.
steps.description: Allow the Rice Krispies pops to sit until fully hardened.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Remove the pops from the baking tray and enjoy!

text: On low heat, melt the butter or margarine in a large saucepan.  Pour in the marshmallows and mix until fully melted.  Shut the stove off and remove the mixture from the heat.  Fold in the cereal and mix well with a wooden spoon. The mixture will be sticky in the beginning, but keep mixing until properly coated. Shape the Rice Krispies mixture into balls. Using a one-half measuring cup that's been sprayed with non-stick greasing spray, scoop the mixture into portions. Shape the mixture into medium-sized balls using greased hands for easier handling. Place the pops on a baking tray and stick popsicle or lollipop sticks in the middle of each ball.  Allow the Rice Krispies pops to cool for about 10 minutes.  Separate your desired toppings into mediums-sized bowls.  Dip the pops into the melted chocolate and roll them into the desired toppings. Gently swirl the dipped chocolate around to remove any excess chocolate. Place the pops on a baking tray covered with parchment paper. Allow the Rice Krispies pops to sit until fully hardened. Serve. Remove the pops from the baking tray and enjoy!
